title: The St. Louis Bank Robbery (1959, Crime) Steve McQueen, Crahan Denton, David Clarke | Movie

sources.title: The St. Louis Bank Robbery (1959, Crime) Steve McQueen, Crahan Denton, David Clarke | Movie
sources.description:
Never before in Police annals! Never before in film history!
Career criminals (David Clarke, Graham Denton) and a local youth (Steve McQueen) carefully plan and rehearse the robbery of a Missouri bank. Complications arise when the sister of one of the thieves starts voicing her well-founded suspicions.

Original title: The St. Louis Bank Robbery (1959)

Colorized version: https://youtu.be/zNre18TVXN8


This film is available with subtitles in many languages.

Directors: Charles Guggenheim, John Stix
Writer: Richard T. Heffron 
Stars: Steve McQueen, Crahan Denton, David Clarke
Genres: Crime,  Drama, Thriller


00:00 Full Movie (with subtitles)

17:17 A series of events unfold involving a bank robbery, a conversation about money, a meeting with Gino, and a confrontation between characters.
31:23 A group plans a bank robbery, discussing their strategy and roles in detail.  They conduct a trial run with precise timing and coordination.while also mentioning a potential complication.
41:51 A conversation between George and Ann takes a dramatic turn as they discuss their past and future plans, while John shares his experiences with starting and quitting various ventures.
47:52 Suspicious activities at a bank lead to a potential robbery, involving a warning sign and a mysterious girl.
56:18 A tense confrontation unfolds as George is coerced into a dangerous situation by Gino and Fowler.
1:01:42 A tense conversation unfolds as characters discuss a plan to leave, leading to a confrontation and a bank robbery.
1:10:04 Dramatic bank robbery unfolds with hostages, police involvement, and a tense standoff.
1:19:37 A tense bank robbery leads to a violent standoff with the police, resulting in tragic consequences.
